intro: Sarcopteryx melanophloea, commonly known as the black phloem vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its dark, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. The plant's unique phloem structure has made it a subject of interest in botanical research.
